summary: The Internet category explores themes like decentralization, ecosystem architecture, and the future of online spaces. Articles emphasize sustainable, regenerative practices and the reshaping of digital environments beyond hierarchical and geographic limitations. Key discussions involve the fragmentation of the internet, proactive alignment against surveillance capitalism, and valuing broken fragments to build resilient networks and communities.
excerpt: Biological ecosystems are defined by space and time, but modern ecosystems transcend these. Ecosystem architecture proposes decentralized, non-hierarchical structures inspired by diverse disciplines.
